discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is Correct.

If a temporary condition exists that prohibits the encryption of emails in the queue (i.e., temporary C-Series busyness or Cisco Secure Email Encryption Service unavailability), messages are re-queued and retried at a later time.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/esa/esa11-1/user_guide/b_ESA_Admin_Guide_11_1/b_ESA_Admin_Guide_chapter_010010.html?bookSearch=true

A is correct.

"If a temporary condition exists that prohibits the encryption of emails in the queue (i.e., temporary C-Series busyness or CRES unavailability), messages are re-queued and retried at a later time."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/esa/esa13-5-1/user_guide/b_ESA_Admin_Guide_13-5-1/b_ESA_Admin_Guide_12_1_chapter_010011.html

questions.question_text:
Email encryption is configured on a Cisco ESA that uses CRES.
Which action is taken on a message when CRES is unavailable?

choices.C: It is dropped and an error message is sent to the sender.
choices.B: It is sent in clear text.
choices.D: It is encrypted by a Cisco encryption appliance.

questions.question_text: Which two features of Cisco Email Security are added to a Sender Group to protect an organization against email threats? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B and D are Correct.
B and D , this is what can be done on HAT

Selected Answer: BD
this is HAT senders : geoblocking and senderbase reputation score from talos IPs.

questions.question_text: Which two steps configure Forged Email Detection? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Enable Forged Email Detection on the Security Services page.
choices.A: Configure a content dictionary with executive email addresses.
choices.C: Configure a filter to check the Header From value against the Forged Email Detection dictionary.
choices.B: Configure a filter to use the Forged Email Detection rule and dictionary.
choices.E: Configure a content dictionary with friendly names.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
B & E are Correct

Selected Answer: BE
BE, Always friendly names not specific address
Just to clarify, in the forged email detection dictionary, we use names of executives and not email addresses correct? for example John Smith , and not JohnSmith@mycompany.com
E because check for dispaly names and not for email addresses as answer A
